Description: Mould-pressed mosaic glass dish with concave sides and a slightly convex base: formed from sections of multi-coloured glass canes (clear deep blue with opaque white spirals), interspersed with segments of yellow and white glass or occasionally gold foil sandwiched between two coloured layers. Two wheel-cut lines inside the rim.
Bibliographic references: Tait 1991 / Five Thousand Years of Glass (pl.53)
Glass 2 / Catalogue of Greek and Roman Glass, Volume 2 (663)
Harden et al 1968 / Masterpieces of Glass (21)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2016, 11 Apr-17 Jul, New York, Metropolitan Museum of Art, Pergamon and the Art of the Hellenistic Kingdoms 2023 4 May - 13 Aug, London, BM, G35, Luxury and Power: Persia to Greece
